result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kevin W. Muzich was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 4 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied - PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.    Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Wisconsin State Patrol.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Attend a Victim Impact Panel.
Cash bail applied - PAID IN FULL.  Balance to be refunded to poster.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Defendant Kevin W. Muzich in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for motion to suppress. Trooper Nicholas Lorenzen sworn & testified. Exh. S1 - DVD - marked. Exh. S2 - Informing the Accused Form - marked. Exh. 1 and 2 offered and received. State rests. Defense rests. Testimony is closed.  Defense presents arguments. Defense asks the Court to suppress the blood results. State presents arguments.  Court finds there was probable cause to arrest. Court denies the motion. Defense requests a further proceedings date. Court grants request. Defense to advise on the next date how they will proceed - trial or plea.  Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 09:00 am.
